data.title: Emmet tweaks: simplify set/reset Emmet preferences and syntax profiles
data.body:
Source: #9500 and #9002

The process of set/reset preferences and syntax profiles for Emmet has been simplify. We don’t have to support undocumented features of Emmet, which don’t have any sense for the end user.

Just use Emmet API.

data.title: Emmet tweaks: remove extra languages from conditions
data.body:
Source: #9500 

The following languages can be removed from the condition:
- [`twig`](https://github.com/Bajdzis/vscode-twig-pack/blob/master/package.json#L68) by TwigPack extension and [`twig`](https://github.com/whatwedo/vscode-twig/blob/master/package.json#L52) by Twig extension
- [`ejs`](https://github.com/Rayraegah/ejs-visual-studio/blob/master/package.json#L22) by .ejs extension
- [`erb`](https://github.com/craigmaslowski/vscode-erb/blob/master/package.json#L21) by erb extension
- [`php`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/php/package.json#L21) by vscode extension
- `hbs` === `handlebars` (We work with identifiers)

The following languages cannot be removed because it does not have `scopeNames`:
- [`razor`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/languages/razor/common/razor.contribution.ts)
- [`handlebars`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/languages/handlebars/common/handlebars.contribution.ts)

data.title: Terminal.name is not readonly
data.body: The  [name](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L3321) of a terminal isn't readonly. Which means folks can assign it which might lead to wrong expectation. My trick for this is using a [getter](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHostDiagnostics.ts#L40)

data.title: Test: suggestions in debug repl
data.body:
test for #8114:
complexity: 3
- [x] any OS - **@alexandrudima**
- [x] any OS - **@stevencl**

As per feature request #8114, debug repl now supports suggestions. Start a node debug session and verify:
- When typing in the debug repl input you get inteli-sense suggestions which make sense
- Upon accepting a suggestion the text in the repl input is properly replaced
- Be creative and use the multi line repl input to try to break the suggestions

data.title: Test: multi line debug repl input
data.body:
Test for #8115
Complexity: 2
- [x] win **@octref**
- [x] mac **@kieferrm**
- [x] Linux **@rebornix**

Debug repl input now expands / shrinks as the input grows up to a limit. Verify:
- Typing / pasting large strings into the debug repl input makes the input expand
- Shift + enter expands the input
- Input shrinks intuitivly
- Once entered the expression is properly displayed in the debug repl

data.title: Test: Multi level variable paging
data.body:
Test for #9537:
Complexity: 2
- [x] anyOS - **@ramya-rao-a**

Write or use a js/ts program with an array/buffer/map/set with more than 10000 items and verify:
- data structures with a large number of children are displayed in multi level chunks (these chunks are displayed collapsed and the children are fetched lazily on expand). For example, an array of 100000 elements will first split all the elements in chunks of 10000 and then those chunks will be split in chunks of a 100. More details: #9774
- Array, Buffer, Map, and Set also display programmatically added named properties.

data.title: Publish sourcemaps for built-in extensions
Multiple-cursors are not visible on first column
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-insider  2f2d65
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. select multiple lines using multiple cursors, or break a multi-line selection into multiple cursors.
2. press HOME to move all cursors to first column
3. Only the first cursor shows up, that too partly covered by the gutter.

Additional details:

Theme: Dark+

``` json
{
  "editor.cursorBlinking": "phase",
  "editor.fontFamily": "Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace",
  "editor.fontSize": 14,
  "window.zoomLevel": -1
}
```

data.title: insertLineAfter exhibits strange scrolling behavior when the same file is in split-screen configuration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 
- OS Version: Windows 10 pro

Screen sometimes "auto-scrolls" to line one when inserting a line with ctrl-enter (command editor.action.insertLineAfter).  Problem only occurs when the same file is present in two visible editors in the window.  The problem is dependent on where the cursor is at in the other editor.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a file with more than one screens worth of information in a split context:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8662470/17994771/b8ee0ed2-6b10-11e6-9a8e-22977e89d889.png)
2. Scroll to bottom line in left editor, and scroll to something like line 7 in the right editor:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8662470/17994804/f04100b0-6b10-11e6-889d-d2e8046eed20.png)
3. Now insert a new line after line 7 with "ctrl-enter'.  Instead of just leaving the cursor and screen where it previously was and adding a new line, the right editor scrolls and makes file line 7 be screen line 1.  It then opens a new line on line 2:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8662470/17994844/3e54ece4-6b11-11e6-9d3d-369b9faa3d63.png)

This is extremely annoying because there's a "lurch" and you lose your place as to where you are, plus you can no longer refer to the lines immediately above the inserted line.

4)  If both editors are "on the same page", so to speak, and both showing roughly the same position, then the scrolling does _not_ happen, and insertLine works as expected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8662470/17994911/d08da894-6b11-11e6-865e-a24d7f2c7f78.png)

Note how in this screen shot, file line '7' is still at line 7 on the screen.

There's an interplay between the two editors when it comes to the logic about where to position the cursor.  As far as cursor position goes, they should be completely independent of each other.  If another file is open in the left window (file 'so_question.ts' in this screenshot), then the cursor in the right works as expected no matter where the cursor is positioned in it's twin (the non-visible editor).  So it's only _visible_ editors sharing the same file that this interference happens on.

data.title: [Bug] Keybindings.json command is not surrouned by double quotes when auto-complete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open `keybindings.json` via Preferences: Open Keyboard Shortcuts.
2. Move the end of the file, and add new key block by type:

```
{
  "key": "ctrl+e",
   "command": <cursor>
}
```
1. Now type `cur`, it would show completion for cursorBottom, cursorBottomSelect, etc... 
2. Press `<tab>`.  Expect to see `"cursorBottom"`. But saw `cursorBottom` without double quotes.

Also notice that if at step 4 we start with `"cur` then no completion will be show up.

data.title: Feature request: Option to disable auto creation of the ".vscode" folder
data.body: I know I'm not alone when I say I use VS Code as just a text editor and not an IDE, yet the editor still forces that annoying .vscode folder into any directory you open the program in. I don't need it to save project or workplace settings. I just want a good looking text editor without any residue of where it's been used. I'm getting tired of deleting the folder every single time. Please add an option to disable it.

data.title: shortcut in Japanese keyboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.6
- Apple wireless Japanese keyboard
- Karabiner 10.21.0
  - "Use Japanese Keyboard as US Keyboard" turned on.
  - Some other assignments are on but I think they are not related.

Steps to Reproduce:
When I press "CMD+]" it splits the window where indent is expected.
I'm using Karabiner to match the behavior with US keyboard but it doesn't seem to work as expected. Replacing it with US keyboard worked as expected.

I don't see similar oddities when using Atom or SublimeText. I imagine VSCode is reading native keypress events?
#6020 seems to be related.

cc: @aioutecism

data.title: Code Format Bug - Insider Preview 1.5.0
Count lines in getHeightForString - fix #10980
data.body:
FYI @isidorn -

Looks like for output, there's one item per line created in debugModel, but for the input, there's only one item, so we need to count lines to calculate height.

data.title: node does not run from built in terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
**Node works:**
1. Open VS Code by double clicking on its icon.
2. Open terminal (ctrl-`).
3. Write node -v in terminal.
4. Everything works fine

**Node does not work:**
1. Open VS Code by right-clickin on a Folder and Opan in VSCode
2. Open terminal (ctrl-`).
3. Write node -v in terminal.
4. Node will not work.

data.title: Suggestion: Start VSCode debugger from the command-line

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
It would be nice to be able to start the VSCode debugger from the command line, for example:

```
# within a workspace
code --start-debug "Launch" # start debugger using "Launch" configuration in .vscode/launch.json

# outside of a workspace
code --launch "node ./file.js arg" # launch "node" debugger for file.js
code --attach "node" # attach "node" debugger using command.PickProcess
code --attach "node:5858" # attach "node" debugger to port 5858
```

In addition, it would be nice to be able to launch another instance of vscode in debug mode as part of a debug configuration entry in .vscode/launch.json.

This would serve to make extension development easier (e.g. debug with the language client in one vscode instance, and start another instance to debug the language server).

data.title: Implement Feature Request from 9213
data.body:
Added a new context menu entry 'Edit in External Editor' to the file
explorer which allows a person to open any file (not just the active
file) in an external program (configurable through a config key called
'externalEditor').

Implements #9213
